r[false] Path to where the settings.xml file will be written. Default is ~/.m2.

r[false] def[${{ github.server_url == 'https://github.com' && github.token || '' }}] The token used to authenticate when fetching version manifests hosted on github.com, such as for the Microsoft Build of OpenJDK. When running this action on github.com, the default value is sufficient. When running on GHES, you can pass a personal access token for github.com if you are experiencing rate limiting.
A boolean value to indicate an exact match was found for the primary key
Distribution of Java that has been installed
Path to where the java environment has been installed (same as $JAVA_HOME)
Actual version of the java environment that has been installed
r[false] The architecture of the package (defaults to the action runner's architecture)

r[false] The path to a dependency file: pom.xml, build.gradle, build.sbt, etc. This option can be used with the `cache` option. r[false] def[always] Specifies when a Job Summary should be inluded in the action results. Valid values are 'never', 'always' (default), and 'on-failure'.

r[false] def[never] Specifies when each Job Summary should be added as a PR comment. Valid values are 'never' (default), 'always', and 'on-failure'. No action will be taken if the workflow was not triggered from a pull request.

r[false] Develocity access key. Should be set to a secret containing the Develocity Access key.
r[false] Allow communication with an untrusted server; set to _true_ if your Develocity instance is using a self-signed.
r[false] Enables capturing the paths and content hashes of each individual input file.
r[false] The version of the Common Custom User Data Gradle plugin to apply, if any.
r[false] Enforce the configured Develocity URL over a URL configured in the project's build; set to _true_ to enforce publication of build scans to the configured Develocity URL.
r[false] Enables Develocity injection.

r[false] def[always] Specifies when a Job Summary should be inluded in the action results. Valid values are 'never', 'always' (default), and 'on-failure'.

r[false] Accept arbitrary user-defined checksums as valid. Comma separated list of SHA256 checksums (lowercase hex).
r[false] def[false] Allow Gradle snapshot versions during checksum verification. Boolean, true or false.
r[false] def[1] Minimum number expected gradle-wrapper.jar files found in the repository. Non-negative number. Higher number is useful in monorepos where each project might have their own wrapper.
The path of the Gradle Wrapper(s) JAR that failed validation.
r[false] def[false] A flag to read and output all the properties from the file
r[false] A value to return in case of any errors
r[true] A file to read
r[false] A property to read from the file
Property's value
r[false] An optional flag which indicates if we should update a release if it already exists. Defaults to false.
r[false] An optional set of paths representing artifacts to upload to the release. This may be a single path or a comma delimited list of paths (or globs)
r[false] The content type of the artifact. Defaults to raw
r[false] An optional flag which indicates if artifact read or upload errors should fail the build.
r[false] An optional set of paths representing artifacts to upload to the release. This may be a single path or a comma delimited list of paths (or globs)
r[false] An optional body for the release.
r[false] An optional body file for the release. This should be the path to the file
r[false] An optional commit reference. This will be used to create the tag if it does not exist.
r[false] When provided this will generate a discussion of the specified category. The category must exist otherwise this will cause the action to fail. This isn't used with draft releases
r[false] Optionally marks this release as a draft release. Set to true to enable.
r[false] def[false] Indicates if release notes should be automatically generated.
r[false] def[legacy] Indicates if the release should be the "latest" release or not.
r[false] An optional name for the release. If this is omitted the tag will be used.
r[false] def[false] Indicates if the release body should be omitted.
r[false] def[false] Indicates if the release body should be omitted during updates. The body will still be applied for newly created releases. This will preserve the existing body during updates.

r[false] def[false] Indicates if the draft flag should be omitted during updates. The draft flag will still be applied for newly created releases. This will preserve the existing draft state during updates.
r[false] def[false] Indicates if the release name should be omitted.
r[false] def[false] Indicates if the release name should be omitted during updates. The name will still be applied for newly created releases. This will preserve the existing name during updates.

r[false] def[false] Indicates if the prerelease flag should be omitted during updates. The prerelease flag will still be applied for newly created releases. This will preserve the existing prerelease state during updates.
r[false] Optionally specify the owner of the repo where the release should be generated. Defaults to current repo's owner.
r[false] Optionally marks this release as prerelease. Set to true to enable.
r[false] def[false] Indicates if existing release artifacts should be removed, Defaults to false.
r[false] def[true] Indicates if existing release artifacts should be replaced. Defaults to true.
r[false] Optionally specify the repo where the release should be generated. Defaults to current repo
r[false] def[false] When skipIfReleaseExists is enabled the action will be skipped if a non-draft release already exists for the provided tag.
r[false] An optional tag for the release. If this is omitted the git ref will be used (if it is a tag).
r[false] def[${{ github.token }}] The Github token.
r[false] def[false] When allowUpdates is enabled, this will fail the action if the release it is updating is not a draft or a prerelease.
The HTML URL of the release.
The identifier of the created release.
The URL for uploading assets to the release.
r[false] def[CHANGELOG.md] Path to the changelog file
r[false] Scopes to exclude from the Changelog
r[false] def[build,docs,other,style] Types to exclude from the Changelog
r[false] The tag from which the changelog is to be determined (only if using tag range)
r[false] def[false] Whether to include commits that don't respect the Conventional Commits format
r[false] def[true] Should the changelog include the issues referenced for each PR.
r[false] Types to restrict to for the Changelog (overrides excludeTypes if defined)
r[false] def[false] List commits in reverse order (from newer to older) instead of the default (older to newer).
r[false] The latest tag (which triggered this job) (only if using latest tag)
r[false] The tag up to which the changelog is to be determined (only if using tag range)
r[true] GitHub Token
r[false] def[true] Prepend type headers with their corresponding gitmoji
r[false] def[true] Should CHANGELOG.md be updated with latest changelog
Generated changelog
r[false] Add options (eg. -u)
r[false] def[${{ github.head_ref }}] Git branch name, where changes should be pushed too. Required if Action is used on the `pull_request` event
r[false] def[${{ github.actor }} <${{ github.actor }}@users.noreply.github.com>] Value used for the commit author. Defaults to the username of whoever triggered this workflow run.
r[false] def[Apply automatic changes] Commit message
r[false] Commit options (eg. --no-verify)
r[false] def[41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com] Email address used for the commit user
r[false] def[github-actions[bot]] Name used for the commit user
r[false] def[false] Create new branch with the name of `branch`-input in local and remote repository, if it doesn't exist yet.
r[false] def[false] Stop the shell from expanding filenames (https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Filename-Expansion.html)
r[false] def[.] File pattern used for `git add`. For example `src/*.js`
r[false] def[git] Internal use only! Path to git binary used to check if git is available. (Don't change this!)
r[false] Push options (eg. --force)
r[false] def[.] Local file path to the git repository. Defaults to the current directory (`.`)
r[false] def[false] Skip the call to git-checkout.
r[false] def[false] Skip the check if the git repository is dirty and always try to create a commit.
r[false] def[false] Skip the call to git-fetch.
r[false] Status options (eg. --untracked-files=no)
r[false] Message used to create a new git tag with the commit. Keep this empty, if no tag should be created.
Value is "true", if the repository was dirty and file changes have been detected. Value is "false", if no changes have been detected.
Full hash of the created commit. Only present if the "changes_detected" output is "true".
